content.raw:
Hmm, I was still able to get a crash, with this error message.

```
[Wrn] [Scene.cc:2789] Duplicate visuals detected[unit_box_1::link__APPLY_WRENCH____FORCE_VISUAL__]
[Wrn] [Scene.cc:2789] Duplicate visuals detected[unit_box_1::link__APPLY_WRENCH____TORQUE_VISUAL__]
[Wrn] [Scene.cc:2789] Duplicate visuals detected[r2::/r2/neck_base__APPLY_WRENCH____FORCE_VISUAL__]
[Wrn] [Scene.cc:2789] Duplicate visuals detected[r2::/r2/neck_base__APPLY_WRENCH____TORQUE_VISUAL__]
[Wrn] [ApplyWrenchVisual.cc:428] No torque visual
[Wrn] [ApplyWrenchVisual.cc:394] No force visual
```

branch is apply_force_dialog_scene_cleanup, 6799833

I also find that if I move the force arrow out from the model a bit and then click on the torque arrow, I can get the purple axes to jump out back around the torque arrow and jump back to the force arrow.
